Description: Handle-plate of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater with part of handle; on top, black-figure decoration consisting of lion with added red on neck, sejant to right, head reverted.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Robinson took the creature on the handle plate as a sphinx! Marked '29' in uncertain medium
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 229, no. 145)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.191) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4671 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
